TopicTitle: Hello and a status report from my first mission to Minmus

Articles.Content:
Hello to all.

 

I had to tell someone who might care so I'm putting it here.  :-)  I'm just now landing from my first flight to Minmus.  I only had enough delta-V to enter Kerbin atmosphere on the return trip.  Given that, I had to "airbreak" 3 times in the atmosphere to slow down enough to drop to the ground.  LOL.  It took all my battery power too (as I was trying to stay retrograde).

 

I hope my next flight to Minmus isn't so "close" to failure.  :-P

20 minutes ago, daxm said:

I hope my next flight to Minmus isn't so "close" to failure.  :-P

Close to failure? Nah. Close to failure is getting out and pushing.

 

Also, welcome to the forums.

Edited March 3, 2017 by IncongruousGoat

No pictures? That's half the fun of accomplishing something in KSP. 

 

Welcome to the forum, daxm.
I love Minmus for it's varied terrain. I've got a station orbiting it and a base on it's surface. Congrats on getting there and back!
